Nicholas Woon, Marketing Director at ERA Realty Network Pte LtdLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 26 Sep 2018Hi,​If you intend to upgrade to EC, you would be required to sell your HDB within 6 months of key collection of your new EC unit. There is no ABSD incurred for purchase of new EC since you are required to sell your HDB. Loan will still be considered as first housing loan (75%) since you are required to dispose your HDB after TOP of EC (ie. doesn't matter whether you have outstanding loan now or not). ​I would not encourage transfering your CPF OA to SA unless you are confident of paying the 20% downpayment of EC with your CPF OA even after the transfer. Either that, or you intend to use 25% cash in your downpayment for the EC. ​There are a few things to consider. If you don't require your CPF OA for the downpayment of EC (20%) and don't forsee yourself needing the cash savings, you can go ahead to transfer the funds to your SA. However, if you do intend to purchase a secondary property or upgrade in the future, you wouldn't be able to use your SA to finance the purchase! ​Personally, I would be more comfortable using my CPF OA to settle the 20% downpayment. I would not be so concerned in the accrued interest of the CPF OA as I know that the capital appreciation of EC would easily cover it!​Hope this clarifies most of your concerns! :)0 comments1
